title: Scotland's Malt Whisky Trail
text:
Eight <a href="malt%20whisky">malt whisky</a> <a href="distillery">distilleries</a> and a <a href="Cooper%20%28profession%29">cooperage</a> form the Malt Whisky Trail in Scotland's <a href="Strathspey%2C%20Scotland">Speyside</a>. Seven of the eight distilleries are in production and operational, whilst the <a href="Dallas%20Dhu%20distillery">Dallas Dhu distillery</a> is a historic distillery. The Malt Whisky Trail is a local <a href="theme%20route">theme route</a> marketing initiative, established to promote the region's whisky-related <a href="cultural%20heritage">cultural heritage</a> and encourage tourism.
Over half of Scotland's malt whisky distilleries are in Speyside, not all of which are open to the public. The <a href="heritage%20trail">heritage trail</a> consists of the following <a href="Speyside%20single%20malt">Speyside single malt</a> distilleries and a cooperage.
A 2012 BBC article recommends a leisurely tour. "Though the distilleries are fairly close together, leisurely travellers may want to dedicate a few days to taking in the distinct traditions and lore at each stop.
